name: Dungeon Nightmares II : The Memory
description: Dungeon Nightmares II is a first-person psychological horror that takes you through a journey of discovering what nightmares are.The game is inspired by classic roguelike games which include 100% procedural-generated maps and permadeath.
minimum_requirements: OS: 7 Memory: 4 GB RAM DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 2 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: 7 Memory: 8 GB RAM DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: (eng) / (rus) Another Unity engine first-person horror. Sounds scary enough? Yep, I also shake everytime I see the logo at the start. Apart from that it's a decent randomized story about a woman who suddenly got lost in a nightmarish maze of copy-paste elements and merciless triggers under her hotel. She probably woke up from a bad dream in her room and decided to go check in the basement for the continuation.. or vice versa. Anyway, she's trapped in that empty old building with rusty elevators, clanging chains and pixellated cobwebs. There we also 100% encounter missing girl's portraits, used torture instruments, sceleton parts, mouldy books etc. She can't run or duck, but she can light the unnecessary candles if you find some and interact with objects. The game's not bad, the random architecture, strange letters and realistic sound effects keep the intrigue alive. Remember, you totally don't have to feel scared until the trigger works, but certainly no one shall stop you if you want to! Also, to shut a screamer up I just shout some obscene words at the monitor twice as loud, this helps a lot! Have fun!  Еще один ужас от первого лица на двигле Единство. Звучит достаточно страшно? Я тоже трясусь каждый раз, как вижу этот логотип при запуске. В остальном это неплохая случайно генерируемая история про женщину, которая внезапно потерялась в жутком лабиринте размноженных под копирку элементов и беспощадных спусковых крючков под ее гостиницей. Она, видимо, проснулась от дурного сна в своей комнате и решила сходить проверить в подвале насчет продолжения... или наоборот. В любом случае, она поймана в этом пустом старом здании с ржавыми лифтами, звенящими цепями и пикселизованными паутинами. Также мы стопудово встретим портреты пропавшей девочки, б/у пыточный инструментарий, части скелетов, плесневелые книжки и пр. Она не может бегать и приседать, но умеет зажигать бесполезные свечи, если удастся их найти, и взаимодействовать с объектами. Игра не плоха, случайная архитектура, странные письма и реалистичные звуки поддерживают интригу. Только помните, что совсем не обязательно бояться, пока не сработает спусковой механизм, но если хотите, то никто не собирается мешать! Также, чтобы заткнуть крикуна, я просто матерюсь в экран вдвое громче него, это здорово помогает! Наслаждайтесь!

I got Dungeon Nightmares 2 on its release day, but never had the time to give it a review.  Dungeon Nightmares 2 is a great game with great atmosphere, that provides a good challenge, and definitely a good scare, in fact it's the only horror game to keep scaring me after the first time playing! The random generation gives it a lot of replayability, and the Challenge Chamber is pretty fun too!  If I had to rate this game from 1 to ♥♥♥♥ my pants,... hang on, gotta go change my pants.
Never have I played a game so suspenseful and scary, that I've wanted to throw up. Great game and I recommend to anyone wanting that late night scare.

Really sets the standard for unity based horror games. Sets the atmosphere perfectly, very well done traps, enemies, and level design. For its low price, it's a great experience and easy to get immersed in.

What the hell your supposed to do? I'm not sure....  All I can say is...  Dim down your room lighting, crank up the surround sound......kick everyone out of the room.......  now you can throw your soiled underwear out of the window undetected.  Seriously, great use of sounds - dont have a clue what the game involves, just seem to wonder around underground basements in near darkness, then jumpscare your kecks off.........funny and worth a few quid for that alone.  Not one for grandpappa and his pacemaker!
'Don't press C' - The Game. Also known as 'Stethoscope Simulator'.

Could have been good, but lacks basic level design and functions.  After 2 hours I was bored to tears. After a while you start to see the same design in every room.  There is very little to do but walk, walk, and walk some more. A very FEW jump scares try and make up for the fact there is nothing in this game the gives the player any incentive to keep playing.  I was willing to overlook the Unity Engine build and go for a good game, but this one fails to deliver.
Oh yeah! Me likey :) Already awesome!!
